messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]  Sacrilege was Mother-In_law
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/17/02 5:04:29 PM, ejcrewe@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/17/02 5:04:29 PM, ejcrewe@... writes:

<< Ok, we do see movies on video or dvd and I'll look for one with him in it
to
give you my opinion. >>

Truly, Madly, Deeply is really good. I watched it because of discussions
online (here or somewhere) about Alan Rickman, and its really wonderful.

The first Harry Potter can be fun, but if you don't like antsy, that might be
no good.

Galaxy Quest is all around wonderful.
Sense and Sensibility is good, if you can stand that period (1800ish).

Sandra

OK. We just watched HP. LOVED IT! It was scary and exciting and Lucius Malfoy
(or as I've been calling him Luscious Malfoy) was brilliant.
About Alan Rickman....
Just don't see it.
Sorry, but Yuck. He has such a puffy face! Not MY Snape.
Elissa the Heretic
